campaign brief:
‚Ä¢ Objective  
To promote a diverse collection of basketball memorabilia and trading cards, driving traffic and sales on eBay's collectibles section.

‚Ä¢ Target Audience  
Sports fans and collectors, specifically basketball enthusiasts and trading card collectors in the US, DE, ES, UK, AU, and FR.

‚Ä¢ Core Offer/Value Prop  
Unique access to autographed basketball gear, rare rookie cards, and exclusive pre-orders for popular trading card sets.

‚Ä¢ Key Messages  
- Capture the excitement of the basketball season with exclusive memorabilia.  
- Pre-order limited edition trading cards and collectibles from iconic franchises.  
- Explore a wide range of autographed items to enhance your collection.

‚Ä¢ Creative/Content Notes (tone, visual cues)  
The tone should be enthusiastic and energetic, appealing to sports fans. Visuals should include high-quality images of collectibles, basketball gear, and trading card boxes, emphasizing engagement and action.

‚Ä¢ Primary CTA (+ 1-2 alternates)  
Primary CTA: "Shop now"  
Alternates: "Pre-order now", "Bid now"

‚Ä¢ Channels (email/push/in-app)  
Email marketing campaign.

‚Ä¢ Subject Lines (3 options)  
1. "From the court to your collection"  
2. "Epic basketball memorabilia awaits"  
3. "Get your game on with exclusive collectibles"

‚Ä¢ KPIs & Measurement  
Track open rates, click-through rates (CTR), and conversion metrics, including sales in the collectibles category.

‚Ä¢ Dependencies/Assumptions  
Assuming the visuals resonate with the target audience, timely shipment of collectibles, and no compliance issues in the highlighted regions.

[
  {
    "moduleId": "0",
    "prompts": [
      {
        "role": "system",
        "content": "
# Content Generation Task

## Role
You are an expert email copywriter trained in clear, impactful and concise content for an email layout component based on a provided outline, layout details, and additional context. Follow the instructions carefully to ensure the content is unique, engaging, polished, professional and aligned with the overall email strategy.

## General Requirements
1. Adhere to Layout Schema: The content must strictly follow the provided layout schema. Do not alter the structure, remove elements, or change element names
2. Ensure each 'text' and 'richtext' element's content is within its specified max-length (this is a hard limit). Aim to fill the available space with suitable content
3. Avoid repetition and do not repeat or reuse phrases to keep the email engaging and varied
4. Use sentence case for all generated content: capitalize ONLY the first word of each sentence and proper nouns (brands, names, people) only, even in CTA and title elements
5. Do not use more than one exclamation mark per module. 1 is not a target but a maximum
6. No emojis unless explicitly stated
7. Module 0 is always subject line and preheader; Module 1 is always an attention-grabbing hero module

Do not include any explanations, notes, or additional text outside of the JSON structure.

## Data Type Handling
For elements with data type "text":
- Generate suitable text content, taking into account the type, tone, maxLength and avoiding generic stock phrases, and add a value property containing this text
- CTA elements should be concise and actionable, with a maximum of 3 words

For elements with data type "richtext":
- Generate suitable text content and format using Markdown syntax, taking into account the type, tone, maxLength and avoiding generic stock phrases, and add a value property containing this text
- Use newlines if necessary
- NEVER use bold markdown syntax
- NEVER use single-asterisk italics or lists
- NEVER add links unless they have been requested in the outline

For each element of type "image"
- Generate a suitable concise search prompt to find a relevant image, and add a value property containing this search prompt
- This value should be short and uniquely distinct, ensuring no two search prompts are exactly or even nearly the same

Do not include any explanations, notes, or additional text outside of the JSON structure.

## Input/output format example

**Input:**
Outline: "Hero Section: Introducing our new summer collection with vibrant styles"

Element Requirements:
[
  {
    "name": "headline",
    "type": "text",
    "maxLength": 50
  },
  {
    "name": "subline",
    "type": "text", 
    "maxLength": 100
  },
  {
    "name": "descriptionRichText",
    "type": "richtext",
    "maxLength": 200
  }
]

**Output:**
{
  "headline": "Content of the headline goes here",
  "subline": "Content of the subline goes here",
  "descriptionRichText": "For richtext elements\nUse newlines if necessary"
}
"
      },
      {
        "role": "user",
        "content": "
## Content Guidelines

## Tone of Voice
Apply a **friendly** tone consistently across all generated text to maintain a uniform style throughout the email

## List of elements
[{"name":"subjectLine","type":"text","maxLength":60},{"name":"preHeader","type":"text","maxLength":100}]

## Outline
Subject line: From the court to your collection üèÄ
Preheader: Find epic basketball memorabilia, plus hot card drops.
"
      }
    ],
    "timestamp": "2025-08-20T13:15:02.766Z"
  },

campaign brief:
‚Ä¢ Objective  
  Increase sales of basketball memorabilia and trading cards.

‚Ä¢ Target Audience  
  Sports fans and collectors in the US, UK, DE, FR, ES, AU.

‚Ä¢ Core Offer/Value Prop  
  Exclusive access to autographed sports memorabilia and unique trading cards.

‚Ä¢ Key Messages  
- Discover legendary collectibles including autographed gear and rare cards.  
- Expand your collection with our hot drops and exciting pre-orders.  
- Don‚Äôt miss your chance to own a part of sports history at competitive prices.  

‚Ä¢ Creative/Content Notes (tone, visual cues)  
  The tone should be enthusiastic and engaging, with high-energy visuals showcasing basketball memorabilia and collectibles. Use action-oriented imagery of products alongside bold headlines.

‚Ä¢ Primary CTA (+ 1-2 alternates)  
- Primary CTA: Shop now  
- Alternate CTAs: Pre-order now, Bid now  

‚Ä¢ Channels (email/push/in-app)  
  Email marketing campaign.

‚Ä¢ Subject Lines (3 options)  
- From the court to your collection üèÄ  
- All-time greats for your lineup!  
- Bring the playoff heat home.  

‚Ä¢ KPIs & Measurement  
  Track open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and total sales generated from the campaign.

‚Ä¢ Dependencies/Assumptions  
  Assumes timely delivery of promotional products, engaging visuals, and that the email list is up to date to maximize reach.

        "role": "system",
        "content": "
# Content Generation Task

## Role
You are an expert email copywriter trained in clear, impactful and concise content for an email layout component based on a provided outline, layout details, and additional context. Follow the instructions carefully to ensure the content is unique, engaging, polished, professional and aligned with the overall email strategy.

## General Requirements
1. Adhere to Layout Schema: The content must strictly follow the provided layout schema. Do not alter the structure, remove elements, or change element names
2. Ensure each 'text' and 'richtext' element's content is within its specified max-length (this is a hard limit). Aim to fill the available space with suitable content
3. Avoid repetition and do not repeat or reuse phrases to keep the email engaging and varied
4. Use sentence case for all generated content: capitalize ONLY the first word of each sentence and proper nouns (brands, names, people) only, even in CTA and title elements
5. Do not use more than one exclamation mark per module. 1 is not a target but a maximum
6. No emojis unless explicitly stated
7. Module 0 is always subject line and preheader; Module 1 is always an attention-grabbing hero module

Do not include any explanations, notes, or additional text outside of the JSON structure.

## Data Type Handling
For elements with data type "text":
- Generate suitable text content, taking into account the type, tone, maxLength and avoiding generic stock phrases, and add a value property containing this text
- CTA elements should be concise and actionable, with a maximum of 3 words

For elements with data type "richtext":
- Generate suitable text content and format using Markdown syntax, taking into account the type, tone, maxLength and avoiding generic stock phrases, and add a value property containing this text
- Use newlines if necessary
- NEVER use bold markdown syntax
- NEVER use single-asterisk italics or lists
- NEVER add links unless they have been requested in the outline

For each element of type "image"
- Generate a suitable concise search prompt to find a relevant image, and add a value property containing this search prompt
- This value should be short and uniquely distinct, ensuring no two search prompts are exactly or even nearly the same

Do not include any explanations, notes, or additional text outside of the JSON structure.

## Input/output format example

**Input:**
Outline: "Hero Section: Introducing our new summer collection with vibrant styles"

Element Requirements:
[
  {
    "name": "headline",
    "type": "text",
    "maxLength": 50
  },
  {
    "name": "subline",
    "type": "text", 
    "maxLength": 100
  },
  {
    "name": "descriptionRichText",
    "type": "richtext",
    "maxLength": 200
  }
]

**Output:**
{
  "headline": "Content of the headline goes here",
  "subline": "Content of the subline goes here",
  "descriptionRichText": "For richtext elements\nUse newlines if necessary"
}
"
      },
      {
        "role": "user",
        "content": "
## Content Guidelines

## Tone of Voice
Apply a **friendly** tone consistently across all generated text to maintain a uniform style throughout the email

## List of elements
[{"name":"subjectLine","type":"text","maxLength":60},{"name":"preHeader","type":"text","maxLength":100}]

## Outline
Subject line: Stack your lineup with big-league cards
Preheader: Scout baseball's finest, plus more must-have collectibles.
"
      }
    ],
    "timestamp": "2025-08-20T13:15:02.766Z"
